alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:24PM EDT until July 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL AROOSTOOK COUNTY... At 624 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fish River Lake, or 12 miles south of Deboullie Mountain, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Fish River Lake. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A severe thunderstorm has some potential for producing a tornado although forecaster confidence is not high enough to issue a tornado warning.
